words.definition: When a plant blooms, it makes flowers.
words.example: Roses look so pretty when they bloom.

words.definition: If something is compact, it is smaller than normal.
words.example: A laptop computer is much more compact than a desktop model.

words.definition: A curl is a small piece of something with a round shape.
words.example: The colorful ribbons were bent into curls.

words.definition: To decay is to be destroyed naturally.
words.example: The old wooden house was slowly decaying.

words.definition: Dessert is a sweet food that you eat after a meal.
words.example: Kayla wants ice cream for dessert.

words.definition: To dip something is to put part of it into a liquid for a short time.
words.example: Laurel dipped her strawberry into the chocolate.

words.definition: If something is distant, it is far away.
words.example: Michael could barely see the distant island.

words.definition: An eclipse is an occasion when the moon moves in front of the sun.
words.example: A complete eclipse of the sun is a very rare occurrence.

words.definition: A fairy is a small, magic creature with wings.
words.example: There are usually fairies in fantasy stories.

words.definition: Grace is a quality of moving in a smooth, relaxed and attractive way.
words.example: The ballerina danced with grace.

words.definition: Leisure is time when you do not have to do work.
words.example: Eve likes to listen to music in her leisure time.

words.definition: Mankind is all of the world’s people.
words.example: All of mankind has to work to make this a better world.

words.definition: Passion is a very strong feeling of wanting to do something.
words.example: She had a passion for dancing.

words.definition: A pillow is something that you put your head on when you sleep.
words.example: When I travel, I usually take my own pillow.

words.definition: A pulse is the beat of the heart.
words.example: The doctor checked the patient’s pulse.

words.definition: To refresh someone is to make them feel less hot or tired.
words.example: The cool water refreshed us after we had been in the sun.

words.definition: To sneeze is to suddenly blow air out of your nose and mouth.
words.example: He sneezed after he inhaled the dust.

words.definition: A spice is a flavor for food and drink.
words.example: Two common spices are salt and pepper.

words.definition: To whistle is to make a sound by putting your lips together.
words.example: As he was working, he whistled a happy song.

words.definition: Wool is the hair that a sheep has.
words.example: Grandma made me a sweater from wool.
